page.title: 14 Law and Order-Blackheath
page.content: The Blackheath Village homebeat police officer has to patrol 6 square miles.He visits the village daily.The times of these visits vary in order to make the would-be criminal feel uneasy.The police officer advises the villagers to protect their homes by locking all doors,securing windows & forming neigh- bourhood watch schemes.The officer checks the security arrangements with the shopkeepers & records the details of their keyholders every 9 months. The worst crime committed in Black- heath in 1985 was the hammering to death of a man in Lee Terrace.The most common crimes are shoplifting,car theft and vandalism.Children have become more involved in crime in the last ten years. Blackheath is not difficult to police.
